pageContext.description:
A fragment of a cast copper-alloy socketed axehead of the southern ribbed axe type, dating to 800-1000 BC.



The object comprises of the broken cutting edge and part of the axehead body. It is trapezoidal in plan, triangular in profile and rectangular in cross-section with a slightly crescentic cutting edge. The front and reverse faces are marginally convex with some indentations and pitting. The top and bottom faces are flat with a small horizontal casting ridge. Extensive surface pitting is present on the interior of the axehead. A green patina covers both internal and external faces of the object. Rohl and Needham (1998), p.136, no.335.



Length: 42.1mm, width: 38 x 29.2mm, thickness: 2.9mm, weight: 52.01g.
